initial_reviews.review_title: Full of features and powerful integrations
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Zoho Marketing Automation?
Zoho Marketing Automation integrates extremely well with the whole Zoho suite which we use. It has a very useful visual drag-and-drop interface for building out automation flows (journeys) with a number of configurable actions and triggers. You can trigger actions based on actions on a contact in Zoho CRM, from a webhook, a custom set of tags, set time delays for messaging, add customers to list based on actions and many more variables.

Customers can be assigned to move to another journey, or they can exit the journey once they have completed the journey.

It's feature set is more advanced than other email marketing software I have previously used.

What do you dislike about Zoho Marketing Automation?
The learning curve for Zoho Marketing Automation is a little higher than other tools, but once you get the hang of it, it is extremely powerful.

The email WYSIWYG builder has some limitations and is not as user friendly as the drag and drop interface that some other email marketing tools offer.

What problems is Zoho Marketing Automation solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are actively marketing to customers who have purchased a certain product from us. When the customer is moved to a certain status within Zoho CRM, that triggers them to enter a list. The entrance to a list starts the customer in the marketing automation journey.

This means we are able to better retain customers to come back to purchase other products from us after their initial purchase.

For example, we have emails in the journey that say something like "congratulations on the purchase of your X product, you will find that you also need YY product to help you get the best out of your X product.

Solution; With Zohos segmentation and personalization features marketers can create targeted campaigns based on user behavior, preferences and demographics.

all_reviews.review_title: Cheapest and most efficient business suite for a startup
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Zoho One?
The extensive list of applications included in Zoho One is the best thing about it. There is at least one application for almost all your business needs in Zoho One suite. In some instances, there are even multiple apps that can fulfill your requirement. Do you need an accounting application? You have Zoho books, invoice, expense, inventory, subscription. You have Zoho CRM to maintain your leads and customers. There are Zoho campaigns and marketing hub for your marketing team. Zoho Analytics for BI and business analytics to make dashboards and reports. The best part is that all these applications come tightly integrated, i.e, you do not have to pass data between these applications manually; it'll all happen automatically in the background. All these come at a meager price. I don't think there is any other suite of applications at this price point; hence, Zoho One is a lifesaver for any start-up starting out.

What do you dislike about Zoho One?
The list of applications can become extremely overwhelming when deciding which one to use for which case. This can become even more daunting since even the Zoho support staff won't be able to tell you fully which one you should use. For example, Both campaigns and marketing hub helps you create marketing campaigns; now, which one should you use? Or Zoho books can manage subscriptions, inventory, invoices, and expenses, but there are separate apps for these needs too, so should you use a particular application of just Zoho Invoice? You can end up in analysis paralysis while deciding which isn't beautiful. The second problem is you might not even need all the applications in the Zoho One suite; now, there is no way you can remove a few applications from the billing. You will have to either buy the entire Zoho One suite or buy the applications you need individually, which will make the overall billing very costly

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool but there are too many glitches in the sync to CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Zoho Marketing Automation?
It's incredibly powerful and offers a vast library of tools. There a lot of ways to review performance reports, and the main campaign builder is relatively simple to use. It also syncs with many of the other Zoho products; integration and tracking stats in the other tools within the suite we have was very important to us. The journey builder is also a real boon, and while we haven't implemented the customer journeys yet, we are working on building the campaigns to use in journeys, and look forward to launching it.

What do you dislike about Zoho Marketing Automation?
Unfortunately the syncing frequently does not work like it is supposed to, and I am not speaking of only user errors here.

Also, we thought that the web assistant based scoring to help us qualify leads would be based on cookies, or be syncable with Zoho Surveys or Zoho Forms, but actually it ONLY works if a prospect signs themselves up through a Zoho MarketingHub form, which has a mandatory double opt-in feature creating more obstacles for the end user. This was not clear until we asked someone why the Zoho Forms we had integrated in the MarketingHub Lead Gen tool weren't working to give our prospects scores. Additionally, the emails send through Zoho are going to spam more often than our emails from other email campaign  building services. This includes emails being sent to staff members. Combining this with the double opt-in requirement means that we're basically not able to use web assistant based scoring. (In fact, our VP of Sales didn't even receive the confirmation email after using our Zoho MarketingHub form; another staff member received in their SPAM folder)

Also, for anyone who has used other email campaign building tools such as iContact or Constant Contact, the Zoho campaign builder is less intuitive and there's definitely a bit of a learning curve. It is simple, yes, but you will need to unlearn a number of things that you might think are standard across all platforms.

Recommendations to others considering Zoho Marketing Automation:
Save yourself the headache and go with a more recognizable suite of tools. If we had known then what we know now, we would not have committed to this software.

What problems is Zoho Marketing Automation solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've gone back and forth with Zoho's customer service for weeks now, in an effort to get something as simple as Lead Scores to push to Zoho CRM. We followed all of the directions to set it up, went through a couple of calls with Customer Service, and have received a series of follow up emails from them saying that their developers have fixed the issue, only to discover that it isn't actually fixed. It's been very disappointing since we worked hard to set up email campaign activity scoring (which DOES work) and we want our business development and sales team to be able to sort using the scores in CRM, but it just won't sync correctly. And I can't stress enough that this is taking weeks.

I also want to mention that there is no customer service phone number, ONLY an email-based ticketing service. They will schedule a phone call with you if it is deemed necessary, or if you request one.
